Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
January 1, 1858 from Lucy Twine to Dr. James H. Minor
I take the liberty of again addressing you. hoping this will find you and your family all in good health. We are all well.

By letters from yourself and Mr Nelson I learn that there is an unex pended portion of money for us Now I would like you to send me a Bll. of Bacon, a Grub bing Hoe, a Box of Tobacco a Bll. of Flour a Keg of Butter, a roll of Bleached Cotton a roll of jeans purple & pink Lawns some cheap Calicos, Shoes & Stockings 1 white flowered Muslin Dress a Black Silk Veil, a Leghorn Bonnet, and a pr of Ear Bobs.
My respect to all the friends Aunt Rachel and Martha tell them I am well please to write in answer to this
Lucy Twine to Dr. James H. Minor 1858 January 28
Lucy Twine to Dr. James H. Minor 1858 January 28
